---
title: 'Managing Performance in Technology-Enabled Elderly Care Services: The Role
  of Service Level Agreements in Modular Smart Service Ecosystems'
type: pub
encoding: UTF-8

---
<h1>Publication</h1>
<article id="csl-bib-container-M2PV73I9" class="csl-bib-container">
  <div class="csl-bib-body"> <div class="csl-entry">Mugurusi, G., Syversen, A. G., Hermanrud, I., Ortova, M., Khatiwada, P., &#38; Underbekken, S. (2023). Managing Performance in Technology-Enabled Elderly Care Services: The Role of Service Level Agreements in Modular Smart Service Ecosystems. In E. Alfnes, A. Romsdal, J. O. Strandhagen, G. von Cieminski, &#38; D. Romero (Eds.), <i>Advances in Production Management Systems. Production Management Systems for Responsible Manufacturing, Service, and Logistics Futures: IFIP WG 5.7 International Conference, APMS 2023, Trondheim, Norway, September 17–21, 2023, Proceedings, Part II</i> (12023rd ed., pp. 497–514). Springer Nature Switzerland, Imprint: Springer. <a href="https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-031-43666-6">https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-031-43666-6</a></div> </div>

<div id="csl-bib-meta-M2PV73I9" class="csl-bib-meta">
  <article id="about-article-M2PV73I9" class="about_pub-article">
    <h1>About</h1>
    Mugurusi et al. compiled a comprehensive 4-volume set from the International IFIP WG 5.7 Conference on Advances in Production Management Systems held in 2023. The collection includes 213 papers that explore various aspects of modern production management. Key topics include lean management in the digital age, sustainable service and operations management, digital transformation in manufacturing, and smart production planning. The research highlights how technology, such as artificial intelligence and digital twins (virtual models of physical objects), can improve efficiency and sustainability in manufacturing and logistics. These findings are important because they offer practical insights into how businesses can adapt to new technologies and practices to remain competitive and environmentally responsible.
  </article>
  <article id="keywords-article-M2PV73I9" class="keywords-article">
    <h1>Keywords</h1>
    Technology-Enabled Elderly Care, Service Level Agreements, Modular Smart Service Ecosystems, Lean Management, Digital Transformation, Sustainable Manufacturing
  </article>
  <article id="abstract-article-M2PV73I9" class="abstract-article">
    <h1>Scientific abstract</h1>
    This 4-volume set, IFIP AICT 689-692, constitutes the refereed proceedings of the International IFIP WG 5.7 Conference on Advances in Production Management Systems, APMS 2023, held in Trondheim, Norway, during September 17–21, 2023. The 213 full papers presented in these volumes were carefully reviewed and selected from a total of 224 submissions. They were organized in topical sections as follows: Part I : Lean Management in the Industry 4.0 Era; Crossroads and Paradoxes in the Digital Lean Manufacturing World; Digital Transformation Approaches in Production Management; Managing Digitalization of Production Systems; Workforce Evolutionary Pathways in Smart Manufacturing Systems; Next Generation Human-Centered Manufacturing and Logistics Systems for the Operator 5.0; and SME 5.0: Exploring Pathways to the Next Level of Intelligent, Sustainable, and Human-Centered SMEs. Part II : Digitally Enabled and Sustainable Service and Operations Management in PSS Lifecycle; Exploring Digital Servitization in Manufacturing; Everything-as-a-Service (XaaS) Business Models in the Manufacturing Industry; Digital Twin Concepts in Production and Services; Experiential Learning in Engineering Education; Lean in Healthcare; Additive Manufacturing in Operations and Supply Chain Management; and Applications of Artificial Intelligence in Manufacturing. Part III : Towards Next-Generation Production and SCM in Yard and Construction Industries; Transforming Engineer-to-Order Projects, Supply Chains and Ecosystems; Modelling Supply Chain and Production Systems; Advances in Dynamic Scheduling Technologies for Smart Manufacturing; and Smart Production Planning and Control. Part IV : Circular Manufacturing and Industrial Eco-Efficiency; Smart Manufacturing to Support Circular Economy; Product Information Management and Extended Producer Responsibility; Product and Asset Life Cycle Management for Sustainable and Resilient Manufacturing Systems; Sustainable Mass Customization in the Era of Industry 5.0; Food and Bio-Manufacturing; Battery Production Development and Management; Operations and SCM in Energy-Intensive Production for a Sustainable Future; and Resilience Management in Supply Chains. .
  </article>
